ffmpeg¶

fisspy.ffmpeg(imgstr, fpsi, output='video.mp4')[source]¶

FFMPEG

Using the ffmpeg make a video file from images. The output video is saved at the same location of images.

Parameters:
  • imgstr (list) – List of image filename.
  • fpsi (int) – Integer value of Frame Per Second.
  • output (str) –
    Output video name with extension.
    • Default is video.mp4
Returns:

video – Video file.
Return type:

file

Example

>>> import fisspy
>>> fisspy.ffmpeg(file,10,'fiss.mp4')
